intro: Jepsonia, commonly known as the California buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Jepsonia is often found in the Sierra Nevada and coastal ranges, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
